intro: Syringa tomentella var. rehderiana, commonly known as the Mongolian lilac, is a deciduous shrub native to the forests of Mongolia and adjacent regions of China. It is characterized by its dense, grayish-white pubescent foliage and fragrant, pale yellow to white flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows to a height of 1–3 meters and has a compact, rounded form. It thrives in well-drained soils and partial to full sun, making it a suitable candidate for ornamental planting in temperate climates. Its ornamental value is enhanced by its showy blooms and unique foliage texture.
